channel.title: My friend can't load the silab client and he's tried everything..help me
channel.description:
Ok he gets this message
Error_loader_client - Unable to download client. silabclient was unable to download the client file Login to your computer as an 'administator' user, and then try loading silabclient again. This should give it sufficient access to create save client cache file. Or, create a new directory called C:\WINDOWS\.silabclient_store_32 or /.silabclient_store_32. If possible, set that directory to have full read+write permissions so that all users can write to it. silabclient should then detect that directory and use it for its files. Make sure to accept the java signature it looks like this: if the signature does not come up for you, some security software or parental settings may be perventing you from accepting it.
He is on his admin, or software account on his computer. We have tried making that directory thing. We deleted the old one...Tried loading it...Tried making one ourselves and we can't think of anything else to do. Help, what do we do to fix this?

item.title: My friend can't load the silab client and he's tried everything..help me
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

He’s tried downloading the newest version of java, and he did. And he is o0n the admin account.

Read full topic

item.title: My friend can't load the silab client and he's tried everything..help me
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

Ok he gets this message

Error_loader_client - Unable to download client.
silabclient was unable to download the client file

Login to your computer as an ‘administator’ user, and then try loading silabclient again. This should give it sufficient access to create save client cache file.

Or, create a new directory called C:\WINDOWS.silabclient_store_32 or /.silabclient_store_32. If possible, set that directory to have full read+write permissions so that all users can write to it. silabclient should then detect that directory and use it for its files.

Make sure to accept the java signature it looks like this:

if the signature does not come up for you, some security software or parental settings may be perventing you from accepting it.

He is on his admin, or software account on his computer. We have tried making that directory thing. We deleted the old one…Tried loading it…Tried making one ourselves and we can’t think of anything else to do. Help, what do we do to fix this?

Read full topic
